text: it's no secret that regular exercise can
keep certain diseases at bay which means
time and money saved by less visits to
the doctor on the other hand being
inactive cost the United States about 28
billion a year in medical costs and loss
of productivity but how much does
exercising save you as an individual
according to a recent study people who
exercise at least 30 minutes a day 5
days a week
saved on average 2,500 a year so here's
how it all adds up
researchers track the heart health and
annual medical expenses of twenty six
thousand two hundred and thirty nine men
and women for two years overall people
who paid the most each year had poor
heart health but those people the ones
who exercise spent about three thousand
less here's a breakdown
by comparison the people who spend the
least had no sign or risk of heart
disease but again the ones in this group
who exercised spent less than those who
did it would you say being active is
worth it if not consider this the study
only examined costs associated with
heart health but exercise can keep more
than just your heart healthy studies
have shown it can also help reduce your
risk of developing colon or breast
cancer losing bone density as you age
hip fractures type 2 diabetes and
metabolic syndrome which means you might
save yourself even more than 2500 year
just by staying active
you
